title: 375-A
statement: A. Divisible by Seventime limit per test1 secondmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstdinoutputstdoutYou have numbera, whose decimal representation quite luckily contains digits 1, 6, 8, 9. Rearrange the digits in its decimal representation so that the resulting number will be divisible by 7.Numberadoesn't contain any leading zeroes and contains digits 1, 6, 8, 9 (it also can contain another digits). The resulting number also mustn't contain any leading zeroes.InputThe first line contains positive integerain the decimal record. It is guaranteed that the record of numberacontains digits: 1, 6, 8, 9. Numberadoesn't contain any leading zeroes. The decimal representation of numberacontains at least4and at most106characters.OutputPrint a number in the decimal notation without leading zeroes â€” the result of the permutation.If it is impossible to rearrange the digits of the numberain the required manner, print 0.ExamplesInput1689Output1869Input18906Output18690

processed.result: You are given a positive integer $a$ that contains the digits 1, 6, 8, and 9. Rearrange the digits of $a$ to create a new number that is divisible by 7.  The new number cannot have any leading zeros. If it's impossible to create a divisible number, print 0.
Rearrange the digits of a given number to make it divisible by 7. If it's impossible, print 0.
